articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German and French officials are due to meet representatives of Syria's new governing authorities in Damascus on Tuesday, expanding Western contacts with the new administration after British diplomats met its leader Ahmed al-Sharaa late on Monday.
articles.title: Western governments expand contacts with Syria's new leadership

articles.author: Erin Banco, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An agreement to halt the 14-month-old war in Gaza and free hostages held in the Palestinian enclave could be signed in coming days with talks in Cairo making progress, sources briefed on the meeting said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks gain momentum as officials push for deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bomb hidden in an electric scooter killed a senior Russian general in charge of nuclear protection forces in Moscow on Tuesday, Russia's investigative committee said.
articles.title: Bomb kills chief of Russian nuclear protection forces in Moscow

articles.author: Ali Sawafta, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Palestinian Authority security forces have battled Islamist fighters in Jenin for days, as they wrestle to exert control of one of the historic centres of militancy in the West Bank ahead of a likely shakeout in Palestinian politics after the Gaza war.
articles.title: Palestinian security forces try to exert control in volatile West Bank
Russia intensifies Kursk assaults, piles pressure in the east, Ukraine's army chief says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Wisconsin on Tuesday were interviewing friends and family and examining the online presence of a 15-year-old girl to determine what drove her to open fire in a school classroom, killing a fellow student and a teacher before taking her own life.
articles.title: Police search for motive in Wisconsin school shooting

articles.author: Jean-Stéphane Brosse, Abdou Moustoifa
articles.description: Hundreds or even thousands could be dead in the wreckage of Cyclone Chido, officials said.
articles.title: Mayotte authorities fear hunger and disease; race to help cyclone survivors

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canada's ruling Liberals lost a special election in the western province of British Columbia, provisional results showed on Tuesday, deepening the political woes of beleaguered Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
articles.title: Special election loss adds to misery for Canada PM Trudeau

articles.author: Andreas Rinke, Matthias Williams
articles.description: Germany's main political parties will unveil their manifestos on Tuesday, offering competing visions to lift Europe's largest economy out of the doldrums while fighting off a far-right surge ahead of a snap election on Feb. 23.
articles.title: Parties unveil plans to rescue Germany from economic doldrums

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A woman from the Philippines who was sentenced to death for drug trafficking in Indonesia said on Tuesday she was ready to begin a new life as she prepared to fly home after the two countries reached a deal for her repatriation.
articles.title: Filipina death-row prisoner ready to start new life as she leaves Indonesia
